Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: PattyMaltez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for all your sightseeing needs. Just a few steps from Rome's main train station where you can catch the metro to all of Rome's main sights or simply walk to them. The area is well lit at night, I was traveling alone and always felt safe. There is a grocery store as well as a pharmacy right accross the street. The rooms are clean, the beds are firm but I found that to be the same in all the hotels I stayed in Italy (4 of them) The shower is very small even for a petite person like me 5.3. The breakfast is good enough, they have 2 different kinds of cold meats, also breads, fruit spreads, cereal, coffee, milk, juices, teas, hot scrambled eggs. What I like about this hotel is the location, cleanliness and price. I stayed there twice because of the convenience. I realized I can find better hotels but that means I need to be prepare to pay a lot more. The staff at the front desk were not very helpful but then I had done my own research prior to getting there so I didn't need to ask for their help, but don't think you can depend on their information to get around the city. I do recommend it for their location and sense of security, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aphrodite okay for a quick break”
Reviews.Author: WakefieldMark
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome staying at the Aphrodite opposite the Terminii . A no problem accomodation bet . Staff speak good English and are happy to help .Location is superb , right at the junction of the Metro . The bus from the Airport drops and picks up 100m from the Hotel . As for the hotel, absolutelyno problems ! (no bed bugs). Room was clean , bed was new (maybe) , breakfast was as you would expect , coffee / tea / pastries / ham /bread etc . Stayed on the 3rd floor at the back (no view , but quiet) . Would we stay again , ? yes for a city break

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for short city break..”
Reviews.Author: TessaLeeds
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome for 3 nights and this hotel was so easy to get to, prime position for metro and buses to get around Rome and quite adequate for a 3 night city break. Would not want to spend a week or 2 week holiday here but on a city break you basically need somewhere to wash and sleep. We had read some rather horrid reviews before we went - bed bugs, etc... Do not be put off. First thing I do when I go to a hotel is peel the sheets back and inspect mattresses and pillows - the mattress in our room (309) was spotlessly clean, in fact looked new. Our room was cleaned well and, even though we were at the front of the hotel, it was not noisy and we got a good night's sleep. yes, there are beggars who sleep just outside the Termini station across the road, and start to make their cardboard beds around midnight, and it was quite upsetting to see but they caused us no trouble, and were gone by the time we had risen. Just a word of warning, the walls were paper thin and we could here next door having a conversation quite clearly! Although my cough probably annoyed them even more! Oops! Breakfast was the usual cereals, pastries, yoghurt, toast and eggs (scrambled or hard boiled) - Scrambled eggs delicious actually! Oh and good coffee! So in a nutshell do not be put off by bad reviews - more than adequate for a cheap base to see Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel, but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: debsopinion
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across the road from Roma Termini train station so very handy location if you're travelling around Rome by train. At Termini there are two Supermarkets including a large SPAR supermarket, many restaurants, cafes, clothing, bags, a book shop and gift shops. Being in such a prime position does have it's pitfalls though, and the hotel is noisy (both from outside noise as there is the station & Via Marsala a main road at the front of the hotel, and the hotel at the back, backs right onto several apartment blocks so you can hear lots of noise from there too. In addition to this, there is lots of noise generally from inside the hotel from guests walking up the corridors and noise room to room. Housekeeping isn't great and twice we had to ask for toilet paper as the maids didn't leave any in the rooms after servicing it. Right outside the station are restaurants, an internet cafe (there is free wifi at the hotel though) and some souvenier shops as well. All guests have to pay a tax which is 3 euros per person, per night which was explained to us when we checked in and on the website we booked the hotel through.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but NO frills”
Reviews.Author: BzinVegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights end of March 2012, Reserved this hotel strictly due to it's location (across the street from the train station). We were very pleased not to require a taxi to Termini.....the hotel location is indeed, very convenient. However, if you are going to spend time in your hotel room while in Rome, I DO NOT recommend this property. Rooms (although clean) are extremely small....beds are the MOST uncomfortable of any hotel I have ever stayed (U.S. or Europe). The view.... (there is NONE). Breakfast buffet.....dissapointing, to say the least. Staff......mildly helpful & not extremely friendly. If you need a place to sleep & shower (& nothing more), & need to be close to train station, this hotel will work for you. Otherwise, I would search for something near Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori or Boghese Palace neighborhoods. We will look somewhere else on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Value for Money..”
Reviews.Author: StrangeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly Staffs, Affordable room rates. The room conditions are not bad either. Breakfast is served on the terrace floor, great view of Termini Station from there. Restaurants are just on both sides as you go out from the lobby. For travelers just passing through Rome, this is a great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location if traveling by train”
Reviews.Author: 2lovethebeach
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome by train and found this to be the best hotel for our needs. The hotel is directly across from the train station, so we did not have to negotiate luggage and buses or taxis. The hotel staff was prompt and courteous and we were checked in quickly. The room was very nice, clean, comfortable and not that small for the 2 of us, but you are in Rome so why are you in your room? We used the metro to get around Rome so it was perfect for us as the metro station is also in the train station. Breakfast was included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for tourist in rome”
Reviews.Author: crackersX5
Reviews.Content: Purchased room on last minute for weekend break to rome, choose one close to coach stop for airport and it was spot on, just opposite the Termini railway station so ideal for buses and Metro. We also could walk to some of the sights from there so very good location. Room was bit small but only there for sleeping so fine, bathroom was well stocked and clean towels each day. The room has a safe, hair-dryer and TV. Breakfast was included in our deal and it was a buffet continental style breakfast with some scrambled egg. It was nice and fresh and plenty to eat.There is a lift so problem with getting up and down to 5th floor where breakfast was. There was a small coffee/bar area but not open in evenings. In the vicinity there was lots of places to eat and drink, an off licence and shops also. There was a supermarket right opposite so can buy water and beer in there at reasonable cost. If you want 4 star UK standard then this hotel could disappoint but for the money and our situation it suited us fine. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Johnsorrento2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was positioned in close proximity to the Termini and literally just across the road from the Airport bus stop. A spar supermarket was just across the road too. The room was small but clean. The breakfast was adequate but I would not recommend the stone cold congealed scrambled egg. I would use the Hotel again simply because of the it's closeness to the Bus, train and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizziTraveller
Reviews.Content: Bad location near the Termini Station where homeless were outside, pretty scary but good location ify ou have to catch an early train or plane. We stayed in room 210 and there was a infestation of bed bugs and one lady had to go to the hospital! The staff were nice but did not refund our stay, it was disappointing to say the least. Breakfast was poor, the croissant and coffee as usual, and when I asked for a receipt for our stay, they added Euro 10,00 on top for "taxes"

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Puzzledprez
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good, clean hotel near the Roma Termini station, this is the hotel for you. The location is superb. It is just across the road from the Termini station, like 10 steps away, no joke. As soon as we exited the station on via Marsala, the hotel is right there before our eyes together with a few other hotels. The hotel faces a pharmacy and supermarket. Because it's just across the road from the Termini station, it is very, very, very convenient. There are plenty of restaurants, pizzarias, gelatarias, halal outlets, souvenir stores and shopping around the hotel and inside the station. As far as commuting is concerned, the Metro station is inside the termini station and the hop-on hop-off bus is on the other side of the station. But you can buy the tickets from one of the shops in the station. From the airport, the :Leonardo express stops at the termini station. We arrived quite early in the morning, many hours ahead of the check in time of 2pm. But the lady was so kind to ask us to come back at 10am in time for our room to be cleaned and allowed us to check in. We had our first italian coffee at the station while waiting for 10am. The room is not big, but it was just the right size for the two of us. The bathroom is also not that big but no major complain there. The shower however is pretty small. Really no room to move your body in the shower. Breakfast was decent. Cereal, breads, hard boiled eggs, scramble eggs, and a variety of coffee to choose from. Overall, we were happy with this hotel for the price we paid. The location could not be better. We stayed on 22-24 January 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and definitely LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: CharArt A
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Christmas holidays and I must say it was amazing! Though the room was a bit small (but big enough for two people) the bathroom was really spacious! Definitely the location is the main advantage!just opposite the main train station that can take you there and within walking distance to attractions!Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good & practical !”
Reviews.Author: fabien_voyages
Reviews.Content: We were sent there because the Scott House where we usually go was under repair... We got a room for three, one big bed & a single one. The room was nice and quiet and the heating was fine (at one’s demand), the bathroom was pretty small but comfortable and the shower was under convenient pressure. Welcoming at the reception was OK and breakfast was very complete even at ending time. It’s a nice place to stay in central Rome, so close to Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visitor”
Reviews.Author: seantheskipper
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this Hotel before( 3 Times) we returned because of it's central location beside the Train station and within walking distance of everything to see in Rome,buffet breakfast good ,rooms clean and big (your in Rome so you really need to only sleep)would have no hesitation in going back We took our marriage vows again in Irish College and this was a great base

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishAli10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value for money. It is perfectly located for Termini Station but as other reviewers have said it's on the quiet side of the station. Rooms are very good size for a city hotel and kept very clean. The only thing we had a problem with was the shower, very narrow and no shelf to hold shower gel, shampoo, etc., but taking all other things into consideration we could live with the narrow shower. Breakfast room is on the top floor and is a lovely bright room with a very nice patio area. Food was definitely sufficient to keep you going for a few hours. Reception staff were excellent and very helpful with advice on how to get to places of interest. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Accommodation central to all transport. Comfortable rooms, breakfast only average. Termini Railway station and buses straight across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate, but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: gsp100677
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums it up. Enjoyed my stay thoroughly and loved Rome. Hotel was in an outstanding location - literally directly opposite one of the exits from Termini train station, but not on the seedy side of Termini, or the spot where all the homeless people sleep. A handful of late night trattoria/café/takeaways right next door - one of which we frequently stopped off at for a delicious late night slice of pizza on the way home (can't remember the name - it's the one next to the kebab shop). The included hotel breakfast was poor, but not a concern due to all the excellent and great value cafés and trattoria's throughout Rome. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful. Very handy pad of maps at reception too - just tear a sheet off. Rooms were clean (enough), with nice wood floors. Bathroom was a bit small (though nicely decorated with mosaic tiles), especially the shower, but not so much it bothered us. They forgot to leave any soap, and after requesting they never remembered during the entire trip (5 nights) - didn't bother asking again and just used out own shower gel. Shower had a minor drainage problem - we asked them to fix it, and I think they attempted but unsuccessfully - again we didn't repeat the request. Standard double room (on 3rd floor) itself was nice and spacious, although we heard one of our friends who also stayed here, in a single room on the 1st floor, had a very small cramped room. Bed was comfortable enough, but was two single beds pushed together, so not ideal. Excellent value and if it was marked as 3 star it'd match all my expectations. To qualify as 4 star I'd expect it to be a bit cleaner, not have any maintenance issues with the shower, not have basic amenities like soap forgotten - especially after being requested, have services like room service and a restaurant, and a better quality breakfast, and the decor to be generally a bit more well maintained. Overall we were perfectly happy though, perhaps as our trip was really about spending time out in Rome, and the hotel served it's most basic purpose of a bed for the night, and shower for the morning - and was good value and in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inexpensive, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Robinc41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are only going to be in town for a day or two. I was just there overnight before taking the train to the airport. Located directly across from the main entrance to the Termini train station on Via Marsala, this is ideal. You can easily get to great restaurants and hop on the tour buses. The hotel staff at the front desk spoke English and was always helpful with directions, securing tours, etc. The hotel bathrooms are amazing, the rooms are very small compared to US rooms, so go in knowing that, but you are not in room to spend much time in your room. I think they should invest in new bedding, it freaked me out, so I slept in the freshly bleached sheets and was fine. My room was near the stairs, which are marble and very beautiful, but the lobby noise echos up. If I was just going to be in Rome and day or two, I would stay here again, otherwise I would get something else.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good but not worth to stay...”
Reviews.Author: kazaal
Reviews.Content: Location wise ,this hotel is best. next to the Roma termini station & main bus stop.colloseum is 20 min walkable distance. You can get all bus,metro to visit all places in rome.take bus no 40,64 for vatican city.Room seems very old and furnitures are classic.Internet is okay.no water boiler,tea,coffee inside room.I have requested for early check-in but the front office lady arragantly denied for.It seems like 2 star hotel. breakfast is average, few variety to eat.check out time is 11 AM.They arranged a cab for my early morning flight. it was very xpenssive. cab charged me 50 euro to drop me in fumicino airport.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, adequate facilities, too noisy”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalTourist37 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonable value for money - our room was on the small side but was clean and modern. Breakfast buffet was limited (and heavily sugar-laden) but adequate. The situation is central and convenient for transport. Staff were friendly and helpful. However a previous TripAdvsior review which said the hotel was quiet despite its location (facing the main station) was seriously misleading. Our room, which was on the road facing the station, was extremely noisy throughout the night and we found it difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “good location, horrible stay...”
Reviews.Author: MalluCritic
Reviews.Content: The most convenient for getting around because it is literally across the street from Roma Termini. Stayed there 3 nights, 2 different rooms - the a/c didn't work in the first room (moved to another one and it stil didn't work!), we could hear toilets flushing from the room above, shower leaked, and the food was terrible. The floor would be soaking wet after taking a shower because of a crack. We informed the front desk about all the problems with the 2nd room and they said we said they'd store our stuff in a locked room until another room opened up (which i later found out was a room that smokers used to smoke - so it wasn't so secure - so we passed and decided to stick it out). We also stayed in hotels in florence and venice... this one was by far the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Well located near Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: laguida
Reviews.Content: Aphrodite Hotel is well located, only 200m or so walk from Roma Termini which means its perfect after a long flight or for catching an early train out of Rome in the morning (which is why we stayed here). Unfortunately, after a long flight and in desperate need of freshening up, it took the staff at the desk about 30mins to check us in, it was a bit of a joke. We had a reservation but it just took the guy a long time to copy out all our passport details, and then he got the date wrong, so had to start all again from scratch! They fumbled about trying to give us our room too. Anyway, despite that the room was nice, decently sized, clean & modern. The included breakfast was nothing to write home about, rather simple and a very typical Rome hotel breakfast ie. most do not impress when it comes to food. I mentioned the location is great for convenience, however I would caution travellers that there are many dodgy characters that hang out on Via Marsala in between Roma Termini and this hotel. Just be cautious, don't talk to anyone on the street and walk quickly! (lucky it is only a short walk).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: SamG_10
Reviews.Content: Booked here for a 3 night trip to Roma. First impressions were that room was small, however this was expected. The staff in the hotel were more than happy to offer advice on tourism and the best vendors for tickets ect. Our twin room was spotlessly clean, the bathroom was immaculate, and the towels changed daily and the sheets every other. Breakfast selection wasn’t huge but more than satisfactory for a hotel of this size. Also aircon in room worked a treat, unlike some hotels I have stayed at! Overall I can only highly recommend this hotel as a great base for tourism. Its within like 30 seconds walk of the Roma Termini station (yet not noisy!), which provides direct 30 mins trains to Leonardo Airport via the Leonardo Express train, it also offers access to the newly opened Metro lines A and B. The only criticism is the lack of a kettle in the room, however with the sheer volume of cafes and restaurants on the hotels door step grabbing a caffe was easy! Stay here for a great base to explore the ancient sites, although on the map it looks miles away from the centre it really isnt!

Reviews.Title: “I was so happy to find this place!”
Reviews.Author: Rissa221987
Reviews.Content: After getting to my first hotel I booked for I arrived only to find that they didn't have ac like they advertised and no running hot water so I walked about 2 buildings down only to stumble into this wonderful place...Not only did they have ac the place presents itself really well..very nice hotel clean yes the rooms are small but I was traveling alone and was perfect for me..The room had its own shower which was very nice the rooms are clean the staff was wonderful and very helpful of places to go around the city..and you can't beat the location being across the streeet from the Termani station makes it easy to make it to all the sights you wanna see in no time... I would recommend this to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: quebec80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aphrodite was conveniently located to the Termini train station, which was one of the main reasons we selected it. Wi-fi access was free, but we often lost our connection. Loved the huge jacuzzi bathtub. It was great, especially after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The room was not enormous, but appropriately sized for the price we paid. Staff members spoke excellent English and were very helpful. The hotel also has a storage room where you can leave your luggage if you arrive early or have a later train connection than the checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: roblevy
Reviews.Content: Position of hotel handy for Termini station but noisy despite the double glazing. Room tiny even by continental standards and no drawers in our room, just a wardrobe. Shower flooded the bathroom as the doors didn't close properly. We complained about this and it was fixed but by the next day it was leaking as badly as ever. We never expect much from a continental breakfast but particularly poor in this hotel: machine produced, over sweetened squash rather than fruit juice and 'coffee' from another machine was bitter and undrinkable. Free Wi Fi worked well. This is not a four star hotel as claimed. Might be acceptable for a brief stay if you managed to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel and Rome”
Reviews.Author: Princey25
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and flight through Expedia. Stayed for 4 nights 11-15 July 2011. This hotel is well located at the back of the Rome Termini station. Very well located for getting in and around the city to all the attractions, as it's well located along the Via Marsala street. It's less than five minutes from the Termini - but may seem longer as the exit from the train from the Airport is quite long and you have to walk to the other side of the very busy station. It's a small hotel but very clean and the staff are friendly (even the chamber maids and maintenance guys). Breakfast is served on the 5th floor, there is also a balcony where you can eat outside if you wish. A continental breakfast also, ham cheese, boiled eggs, cereal, fresh fruit daily. Italians do love a lot of sweet things (so there is also a variety of cakes and breads) for me the breakfast was sufficient - but if you're expecting a full English that's not going to happen. To be honest it's was so hot (40 degrees!!) something light was all you needed. My partner who is a big eater also enjoyed it. The room was cleaned daily, with fresh towels - good size shower if your of average size. I can understand why some of the reviews say that it's too small - if you're a large person you may have problems. If you're comparing european hotels with British hotels you may be disappointed - as there is no tea-making facilities (but there's MacDonald's across the road - my partner when out at night to get me my daily night cuppa!! lovely!! You have to remember that it's a small city with lots of buildings and hotels - so you will not get the space that we are use to, for example we stayed in the Travelodge at Gatwick and the room there was far bigger with tea-making facilities and a sofa. There just isn't room for that in Rome. Think about it - how much time do you spend in the room - as long as it's clean and comfortable YOU'RE A WINNER!! We enjoyed it and would come back - actually planning on taking my ex-mother in-law and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here-Not suitable for families”
Reviews.Author: oscar234
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Rome and I have stayed at different hotels each time and this was by far the worst. The staff is VERY rude and all seem to have terrible attitudes. The room was not clean and I found a ton of hair in the bathroom when we first arrived. The breakfast was terrible, the bread had mold all over it and when I showed the attendant she gave me a sour look and threw it in the garbage but left the rest of it out for other people to eat. The area is also unsafe, and every night we came back to the hotel there were people fighting outside. They also did not have infant cots or high chairs. I suggest anyone looking at this hotel to book Hotel Mondial in Repubblica rather then this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean Safe & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: leokat_july23
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently 3 nights. Right next to Termini Station, 10 min walk if you get the train from the airport as we did. Easy to find. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was small european standards, clean & quite. Air Con in the room which is something you will need there. Breakfast served up on the top floor great selection & fresh. Walking distance into Trevi and the Piazza areas. Would I recommend YES. If you dont like walking to everything I would suggest you stay near Trevi this will put you central on the hub of it all. Resturants are around the hotel but would recommend you get down to the piazza area the atmosphere is there. This hotel is Location Location for transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shelzybelz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a trip to Rome. It is relatively small, cheap and clean and rooms were really nice. There was air conditioning, which was very important for us. It’s right across from the train station, but from inside the room there was no noise from outside. The staff were very helpful when we needed information. The breakfast was continental, but didn’t have much, so we tended to eat breakfast elsewhere. We will definitely choose this hotel when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “#1!!!! you won't regret it!!!”
Reviews.Author: starlayna
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aphrodite. I want to get you to the top ten on trip advisor!!! Your rates are reasonable, and you include a great deal for your guests as well: Free internet! This is rare in rome! And believe me it’s necessary to stay connected with pre-purchasing tickets to museums and avoiding expensive long distance calls which can start at 40.00 a phonecall. You get a mini bar (of pops and juices in your fridge 2 euros a piece) that is less expensive than going to a street vendor. Good job!!!! Located directly across from the station, main attractions are an easy straight 2 stops away from you via subway, or a 10 euro cab. (or 25 min walk) staff also provide great direction (more on that later) The breakfeast area is quite nice, located in the upper part of this building, is filled with sunshine and views of a pretty arched portion of the train station. The breakfeast is always filled with fresh products and is maintained exceptionally. The rooms are cleaned crisply every day, and I walked in from leaving piles everywhere, to having folded clothes and tidied belongings. The esthetic is also fresh. Marble floors, a surprisingly large hotel that hides its space when you walk into it, Do not be fooled! This hotel is big once you get in an elevator onto the accomodation floors. Bathrooms that are modern also add to this hotel. Colorful mosaic tiled showers that have phenomenal water pressure. A green hotel through and through that saves energy. Motion detecting lights save power as you walk through the halls. This is my favorite part: YOUR STAFF!!!! Not only is your staff fluent in English, they are phenomenal, informative and approachable. I really took advantage of this (being my first time in Europe) I found that the staff was always willing to give a helping hand even when I thought I was asking stupid questions, I never felt intimidated ( like some hotels make you feel) and they offer many tours and services without feeling pressured into doing them. My favorite staff member was a lady working in the mornings. She was really funny and I enjoyed speaking with her I know that there was a female complaining that this was a sketchy area. i must say that almost every area in a big city will have these, even if you are staying at a 5 star hotel. i *do* recommend solo travelers here. be aware of your surroundings and communicate with your conceirge if you are feeling unsafe. . I want everyone to go here. The rates are amazing and so is the hotel. I am a travel agent, and I have seen my fair share of hotels. Watch out for this one, as it may take the #1 spot in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good bet in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Riknpat
Reviews.Content: The Aphrodite is a nice hotel. An old building on the Via Marsala has been updated with simple modern comforts at a good price for Rome. The floors are blond engineered hardwood with matching blond wood trim and wardrobes. The walls are white with little modern hangings and wall lamps. Not "historic" in any way but sleek and spotlessly clean. The elevator holds five persons comfortably - a record I think in my experience of small Roman hotels. The bathroom was small but well equiped and sported glass shower doors. Hot water was plentiful and pressure was good, good quality towels provided. Beds were narrow and firm in the Italian tradition but comfortable with good linen. The day staff on the front desk were efficient and experienced and spoke reasonable English. The night staff spoke little English but were warmhearted and all smiles. A reasonable breakfast spread is included in the room rates and served in a 5th floor room with a small attached outdoor terrace providing flowers and a breeze but no view. Rooms on floors 2 thru 4 have good fitting windows and individual A/C and heat so traffic noise is kept down and didn't bother us. 1st floor rooms are probably noisier. If you are arriving by train it is great to just turn right and walk out of the station to your hotel. The junction of Metro lines A and B is right there as is the central station for city buses. The area is one of government offices and apartments and a cluster of hotels. The so called "seedy" characters I see around Termini I also see throughout Rome these days and are nothing compared with those we routinely see in downtown American and Canadian cities. I have never heard of anybody being mugged, raped or assaulted. Pickpockets are about (but not as plentiful as at St. Peter's) and wolf whistes and sexist remarks are a latin curse. So I think that this is an affordable, workable, clean, well-run choice in a practical location in a very crowded and expensive city and I recommend it as such. Nothing fancy but good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TG_James
Reviews.Content: One good thing about this hotel is the location of the hotel which is right beside the train station, literally facing the train station. Easy to travel into and out of Rome. Breakfast is good. Room is small, toilet door is broken. Extremely noisy at night as located next to the train station Good Value.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you need to be near the Termini station”
Reviews.Author: foodsearcher_9
Reviews.Content: Why does this place rate 4 stars? Spacious as Rome rooms go - plastic cups, soap dispensers, no lobby, decent breakfast, no change to pay new cash hotel tax, only plus is you're near the train station - assuming you need to catch a train - otherwise don't stay in this area

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for a solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: Maizee11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the recommendation of my work travel agent (i.e. close to the main train station, and value) and I would not return to this hotel on future visits for the following reasons: the location is good as it is immediately across the road from the central station; however there were a number of questionable characters wandering and sleeping outside of the station day and night, just across the road from the hotel that left me uneasy when travelling to the hotel. I also, was not particularity confident in the safety of the hotel as late at night there is no secure entry to the hotel and it appeared that pretty much anyone could enter the hotel via the main entrance and access any of the floors without having to encounter hotel staff. The overall cleanliness of the hotel was poor, the floor of my room had a serious ant problem, I was so scared of transporting the little bugs home that I had to pile all my belongings on top of the mini desk. Upon inspection of the bed on arrival I discovered a disgusting mattress and box spring that clearly had blood stains that were in clear display for view. Honestly the mattress resembled one that you would see discarded on the street- really gross.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find, central, great value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbr108
Reviews.Content: I like being able to find my hotel without a hassel or expensive taxi. The Aphrodite is outside the train station which had the bonus of being very accessible to the metro and all of Rome. Sure, this is not the high end of town but if this is the price range you are exploring you won't be disappointed. There are nice little (cheap) cafes on the same street. Our three night stay was very nice. Honestly, if you are looking for a clean comfortable budget hotel in Rome you can't go wrong staying at the Aphrodite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NW88
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location. Due to the train network in Rome, it was in the centre of the network so it was easy to get everywhere. The bathroom was very small, you could just about stand up in the shower and wash your hair, and that was with your arms touching the tiles on the wall. It was value for money though and for a 3* for 3 nights was ideal for us. The staff were friendly and helpful, reception rang a few restaurants for us to make reservations. I would recommend if you're staying for a few days but it would get a bit cramped if you were there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: markjoe
Reviews.Content: Literally next to the train station, this location is unbeatable for a very few days stay. However, though the bedroom itself was comfortable and pretty roomy, the bathroom was very tight- one can hardly squeeze ino the shower and ther toilet is also very tight. It was at times noisy, though not constantly. The breakfast bufet was not that good, with few choices.

Reviews.Title: “TV and Internet don't work”
Reviews.Author: jeff.francis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights and could not get the internet or TV to work. I complained to the front desk who advised that they had been out for a couple of weeks and they couldn"t the company back to fix it! My response was to call somebody else but I was advised that the owner wasn't fussed and didn't really care! Apart from the internet and TV, this is a good 3 star hotel in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, convenient, simple”
Reviews.Author: Pruej
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night as I wanted to be close to the station for a train to Venice the next day. It is a good location for a short stay. I walked easily to the Colosseum and back. Not glamourous but clean, neat and the service was friendly and helpful. It was also very quiet considering it's proximity to the station but my room was on the other side from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the journey”
Reviews.Author: bubbles068
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definately worth its value in Staff and Service, and was located ideally to all the amenities my teenage daughters and I required. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Felt very safe and secure in this hotel and would highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DQuin
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel directly across from termini, ideal hotel for a weekend break. Rooms were very clean, safety deposit box provided, mini fridge which was very handy, good value rooms for the centre of rome, I would definately recommend this hotel to friends. Lovely restaurant next door Capatello, good food at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for connections”
Reviews.Author: jules304
Reviews.Content: If you use the Terravision shuttle it drops you off virtually outside the hotel, a couple of minutes from the Termini station. I had a single room and there was ample living and storage space for my city break stay. Toiletries were a hand wash and shower cream dispenser, a built in hairdryer in the bathroom sufficed but if you would like to style your hair then take your own. I spotted at least 5 power points in the room. The hotel was spotlessly clean and staff really helpful. My single room had a large single bed, the mattress was a little soft for my liking but that could be down to personal preference. There was no view to speak of but Hey I didn't come to Rome to view the city from my bedroom window!. I spent 4 days in Rome and walked to the majority of sies. I did use the 4Euro daily bus pass on my last day in order to fit in as much as possible in the time I had left.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to train--not so nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: bus64walking
Reviews.Content: Booked a quad but it is really a triple! We had 2 singles and a pull out sofa bed "french bed" that is just a bit bigger than a twin for 2 adults and 2 full grown teen boys! After a horrible first night and misunderstanding with hotel booking staff, they did change us to 2 rooms. The rooms were small and not any niceties. It is directly across from train--so convenient for travel. However, it you are 4 people, take a cab from airport--not train--and stay in better area in town. Prefer to stay near Spanish steps, Trastavere, Pantheon, but definitely not near train unless you need to for quick in and out trips by train!

Reviews.Title: “Good for quick stays near train station”
Reviews.Author: wbt81
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for one night in between trains to and from Rome. We were looking for a relatively cheap hotel near the station and this fit the bill. It was less than a 2 minute walk from the station exit with our bags, had an elevator and a clean room. Thought the price was reasonable for Rome and paid a little less by paying in cash when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BeanIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend from 11th to the 13th March. Our room was spotless and spacious. We requested a room at the back (as previous reviews advised) and it was perfect! The day time reception staff were brilliant, extremely helpful! We arrived hours before check in time and getting our room early wasn't a problem. Our TV didnt work properly but it wasnt a big deal as we were out most of the time anyway. The location was good as its very close to the termini and the shuttle buses to the airport. The entire hotel was very clean and bright. This is the best hotel in this location for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Milly82Dublin
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner are just back from Rome today. We booked the Aphrodite Hotel online and weren't sure what it would be like after reading some of the reviews but we must say it was perfect, very clean, 1 minute walk from Termini station and it's within walking distance of all the sights. We even walked from the Vatican back to the hotel which did take a while! There is a continental breakfast included in the price too. Staff are friendly and rooms were cleaned each day we were there.There is a rooftop terrace for smokers also. There is also free Wifi which we found very handy! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomeEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: We staryed for a long weekend. The hotel is in a great location opposite the Termini Station where you can get metro trains to anywhere in the city. The room was clean, light and airy. The bathroom decorated in a contemporary style. The breakfast was as you would expect in europe- rolls, meat and also some giant pastries including giant doughnuts! The terrace on the roof is nice. Some people comment on the location, yes it is opposite a train station and some people have commented that the area is not so nice but I am very fussy and I wouldn't say we really noticed. I think you are in your hotel so little because there is so much to see in Rome that I wouldn't let that put you off and I think it has been over exaggerated in other reviews. To finish I would just like to highly recommed ristorante Zeus (I think that's what it's called) by piazza republica, doesn't look much from the outside but the food is amazing. I have been back to Rome twice since and eaten there everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: KimmieRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aphrodite Hotel for a total of five nights. I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The hotel staff are all very friendly and spoke English well. The hotel was recently renovated...one of the newest/modern hotels in the Termini area. I found the room clean and spacious. The furnishings were new/modern and the bed was very comfortable. The room included a small fridge and a LCD TV. The bathroom was excellent although the shower stall was on the small side. Great shower water pressure and plenty of hot water!! The price of the room also included a great buffet breakfast with sliced meat and cheeses, bread, boiled eggs, fresh fruit and a variety of beverages. The hotel is also conveniently located right across the street from the Termini station. It took only a few minutes to get to the train station or to use the Metro. Both line A and line B Metro lines are nearby. I found the area safe and never had an issue with safety. I am a solo female traveler and not once did I feel unsafe. My room was also facing the street and I did not have a problem at all with street noise. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a clean, safe and modern hotel near the Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: JamesFD
Reviews.Content: It started badly-we had to pay upfront,although we were promised two days earlier, when we booked this hotel that we didn't have to. We knew it was a common practice in Italy,but in three and below-star hotels it's very hard to get your money back if something goes wrong. Apparently we talked to a different receptionist the other day,because this receptionist didn't know what we were talking about and explained-"I've only started to work here". We decided to pay for one night(we booked two),just in case if we don't like the hotel. We requested a room off the street and the receptionist assured us our room was off the street.When we got to the room,we discovered that it was overlooking the main street.,which was very busy and noisy. Went down to the reception and very surprised receptionist needed to check the plan of the hotel,because-again-she didn't know,because she was new! We got different room with a jaccuzi! We thought that was great,but later,when we came back from exploring Rome and my girlfriend had a bath,we couldn't release the water! The plug got completely stuck! Went down to the reception and the night porter gave us a screwdriver to pull out the plug.Well,we ended up with cut fingers,because it wasn't that easy to do it and I wanted to wash myself too. Next morning and next receptionist-after we told her we wanted to check out she wanted to charge us cancellation fee,because we were booked for two nights.We refused to do so and explained why, so that was fine. The breakfast was nice and our room was spotless and it is close to the train station,but we wouldn't recommend this hotel,because of the front dest.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: JoannaF4
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to someone who is looking for a central position because it is right in the centre, and not too expensive, but I feel the service, in particular could be better such as in the reception area and at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lsdiva06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as the first stop on our round world trip. Its location is excellent as you as so close to the termi to get to/ from airport and for buses to all the tourist sites. Breaskfast was decent and rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were ok but did not go out of their way to help/ advise but this seemed to be rome in general so its not really suprising, There is internet cafe right next door as well and a fab bakery just a short walk too! If you are like us and dont care about flashy rooms just a safe comfortable room then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location for a solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: sher8888
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a typical 3 star hotel - clean, small rooms, decent bathroom. The staff were great and very hepful. Right across from the train station which is convenient, however, it was not a location that I would choose to stay at again. I did not feel safe walking around the area at night and found that it was far from the sights that i wanted to see. The bed was horrible - the springs stuck out. The breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but stole our bank details!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. It did the job...or so we thought. On returning home we found that someone had treated themselves to over £1,200 of goods from the Apple store courtesy of our credit card details. So I would recommend to avoid using their online reservation system on their website and pay in cash if you want to stay here. The theft aside, the hotel has a convenient location and the rooms were OK, though overpriced for what they are.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff = Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: juliawesome
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Aphrodite Hotel for our first night in Italy. The rooms were extremely small, as were the shower stalls. After checking out for our first night (we were going to stay in Florence for the following two nights, before heading back to Aphrodite Hotel for the remainder of our trip), the front desk staff told us that their credit card machine was out of order, and that we would have to pay in Euros. Luckily, we had Euros, but the front desk didn't even have change to give us, because you know, not having cash in register when your credit card machine doesn't work makes perfect sense. Rather than being helpful, the front desk suggested that we go to a nearby ATM and get change (which meant us going out of our way to get change that the hotel didn't have, ATM fees, etc. for us). Definitely no help, whatsoever. After a pleasant hotel experience in Florence, we came back to Aphrodite for the remainder of our trip. Not only was the staff extremely rude and unhelpful, but the hallways reeked of urine. No joke. And our hotel stay at Florence for the same amount of rooms and for 2 nights in a nice, central location was waaaay cheaper than just one night at Aphrodite. When we were checking out for the final time, the front desk staff wouldn't allow us to charge the bill on 5 different cards (for 2 rooms). Rather than apologizing for the inconvenience, the staff member was extremely rude and condescending, telling us that a big city like Rome doesn't allow bills to be split on multiple credit cards (mind you, my friends and I are from New York City). The fact that he refused to be courteous (even though in our outrage, we told him we weren't mad at him, but rather at the situation) really was off-putting. When in Rome, stay away from Aphrodite Hotel. Very misleading, totally unhelpful, and horrible horrible horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to train station, great find.”
Reviews.Author: adabrown
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed in this hotel for our last night in Italy (we spend 17 nights touring the country). We had already been to Rome, but since we were coming from Sorrento, we spent one night here and flew out the next morning. This hotel is literally across the street from the train station, which was really nice after a long trip and having heavy luggage w/souvenirs. It was the smallest room we stayed in, but plenty sufficient for our purposes. It was recently renovated, and felt very clean. We stayed in a room that faced the back of the building, and while the view wasn't great the quietness was! This hotel suited our needs quite perfectly. Not sure I'd want to spend more than a couple of days there, but it really was quite sufficient. Cleanliness and quietness - can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location of Aphrodite”
Reviews.Author: UptownGirl24
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my trip was business visit to Rome. I needed a hotel which was very close to the Termini station. Aphrodite in that sense has an excellent location... it is right opposite the Termini station... on a crowded and happening area... lots of small tiny restaurants, shopping around... and easily accessible to any utility it might need. Location of the hotel is brilliant. Rooms & Service: However, service and rooms are really bad! The service not good... attendents are not courteous... and really unhelpful. Rooms are really small too. Food: The food is very bad... barely any spread in breakfast... just bread... and jams... and the quality was bad too. Nothing compared to the descriptions provided. While my stay was enjoyable... the hotel experience left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Staff helped us out of nightmare !”
Reviews.Author: WKTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of 14 booked into a neighbouring hotel for 4 nights. That hotel was unsatisfactory so we approached the Aphrodite, first impressions were good so we spoke to persons booking out who told us that the rooms were sizeable and clean. The man on reception juggled some rooms around and managed to provide 7 double rooms at €85 per night. The displayed rate was €210 per night. We found the hotel to be clean & modern - facilities were good and breakfast plentiful. Waiter very helpful. The hotel is convenient for the Termini station which is not the best of areas late at night. It can be quite noisy with local drunks and homeless hanging around the station opposite. However there are plenty of police around the station area. Well worth staying there rather than some of the more expensive and inferior hotels in the area. A really good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: Disabledsightseer
Reviews.Content: Really good value hotel, clean & modern - facilities good and breakfast plentiful. Not in the best of areas & can be quite noisy with local drunks hanging around the station opposite. Well worth staying there rather than some of the more expensive and inferior hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Rod80
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for discovering as much as culture as you can, and you just won't miss a minute... this is the perfect Hotel for you, because is just at the city centre (of Rome). You get out of the "stazzione termini", cross the street and you're in the Hotel. About 1 km or less from the "colosseo", "forum", "Santa Maria Maggiore iglesia"... Wonderful! P.S. Ah.. and cheap, at Marsans.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable holiday”
Reviews.Author: kristinaYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Valerio, Paolo and Lethia the staff at the Aphrodite hotel are very pleasant and helpful and makes you very welcome, the hotel is very comfortable and nicely decorated. It is situated opposite the Metro station and it takes only fifteen minutes to get to the Vatican City and five minutes to get to the colliseum. We hope to return to Rome later in the year for another holiday and would definately go back to the APHRODITE HOTEL Thanking you L Thompson.

Reviews.Title: “Horrrrrrriiiiiiiiible”
Reviews.Author: RomeMad
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever seen. Biggest thief in rome. "Wanna"Receptionist if you don't want ur mood to off don't ever look her face. She is big nonsense. it doesn't stop here there all staff are dishonest they stolen purse of my colleague. There cameras are non working. It seems all staff is not being paid well thats why the whole staff remains in tension or they behave so badly with the client. Staff is rigid to understand your problem. No choice for breakfast its very bad. Rooms are conjusted and room temperature doesn't work. veeeeerry veeeeerrry baaaaadddddddd experience. Please stay away with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: Amber-D-G
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting some place close to the train station to get out of town quickly OR if you want to be somewhere you can catch a quick taxi, this hotel is GREAT! Beds are comfortable. It was very clean.They are understaffed, but were very professional. There is a very good restuarant a few steps from the hotel. There is a wonderful deli where you can get fresh meat and cheese on the same side of the street. Breakfast is good if you like pastries. No bacon and eggs here, but we didn't find that anywhere in Italy. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. If you are used to staying in really nice hotel, let it go. You'll be paying an arm and a leg in Rome. This is a great place to lay your head at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED...DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: nytuga
Reviews.Content: Let me start with saying that this hotel is located by the Termini Station, not centralised in Rome, and is in a shady neighborhood. Very dirty, drunk/homeless people sleeping on the street and causing problems. Upon our arrival our room was not ready so we had to wait over 2 hours in a cold and damp reception area. There was no bar, tv nor wireless interenet connection(as they say on their website) so we had to just sit around doing nothing. The receptionist is anything but nice or hospitable. It seemed like it was our fault for arriving at the hotel on time. When the room was finally ready, what a surprise!!!! Beside it being very small, the fake parquet floor was coming apart. Instead of replacing the broken pieces they tape it down. Went to the window to catch a "breather" and was literally looking at an old buildings dirty wall, 4 meters away, which no sun was able to come in. Now lets move into the bathroom, its amazing how they can fit a sink, toilet, bidet and shower into one place with a max of 2 sqm. I am a small girl (1,50m - 55kilos) and still had difficulty taking a shower. My boyfriend practically broke the shower doors with his elbows!!! There is no consistency with the temperature of water, its either freezing or scolding hot. After cleaning up and relaxing a bit we decided to go down to reception and book tours for the next day. It was refreshing to have another receptionist, which was very nice and helpful. I think her name is Julianne. She assisted us in booking tours and answered all our questions. The breakfast was minimal at best. Cold coffee, orange juice and cornflakes. Sliced bread (no toaster), hard butter/jam...no fruit, eggs, sausage, bacon etc. The only good point for the hotel is that the interior is clean. I suggest booking tours ahead and buying a ticket for the get on and off tourist busses. Its a must!!! We bought it for 48 hours and was probably the cheapiest thing we bought. We booked to see the Vatican & Colosseum with "Enjoy Rome" touring company. Our guide was Jannette from Florida. She was great and very knowledgable. The transfers from the airport to the hotel and vice versa is better through the shuttle bus or shuttle taxi with a fixed rate at €45 for two people - do not take the regular taxi. Overall we enjoyed our trip to Rome and would tell everyone to go and see it one time. Its a very historical city, alot of ancient architecture which is worth seeing. A last note, be prepared to spend money. As Rome is one of the most expensive cities in the world with the poorest service. The only good service we received was when being served by foreigners. We stayed 4 nights 5 days which was enough to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: chefgirl23
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, only steps from Termini Station where you can catch one of the many open tour buses of Rome. The neighborhood had a few homeless, but didnt bother us at all. We felt safe coming back at night. The room was a room with a bed and the bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. For the price, it was excellent. Why travel all of the way to Rome to just stay in your room. You are so tired from all of the sight seeing that you dont worry about the firm beds. It is a clean quiet and safe place to stay. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!!”
Reviews.Author: FlLuvstravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we were a little nervous, but the location and price were right and everyone said it was clean, so we took a chance. It was very clean and the room was VERY small. It made the smallest room in a cruise ship seem large! But, we needed to use the train station and we were trying to keep within a tight budget. Everything else was fine. Yes, it's in a somewhat seedy area but I never felt threatened. The train station (which is huge and has it's own mall with restaurants and a multitude of shopping) is within a block. The breakfast was ok, just basically a continental breakfast, but adequate. The one surprise I had was how to turn on the lights in the room. You have to use your room card in a slot in the wall. I would stay there again for a short time. How much time do you plan on spending in your room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “indifferent staff, poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carleen09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Aphrodite on the returning leg of my weeklong trip to Italy recently in June. This hotel is situated virtually next to the Stazione Termini- so, it's great if you are leaving the city and don't want to have to lug your luggage around quite a bit at the end of a stay, being tired and all. I stayed 2 nights and was totally miserable there. The receptionist who checked me in was unfriendly and indifferent. When I asked about the bus to airport being advised in the lobby, all I got was a "I don't know, ask at the station" (and believe me, it was not the result of a language barrier). I found out later that this was the standard reply to any question in general (from different receptionists). The 100 euros per night for a single room OBVIOUSLY has not been invested in staff training on how to make guests "feel at home". Since I mentioned the price, I have to say the other peculiar thing was that the TV came without a remote control- and could not be switched on without it. You need to inquire for it at the reception counter (and they don't tell you that when you check in) AND PAY a deposit of 10 euros to use it. The room itself was just so-so. It was clean at least. The verdict is this: stay here if you are just going to be in Rome for a VERY short time and you want to be able to get the airport train/trains to other cities very easily. To the managers of this property- PLEASE hire some personable people to staff your reception and conduct some training. You guys are in the HOSPITALITY industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, abismal customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: MN_SF
Reviews.Content: The location for the hotel is great. It's about 2 short blocks away from Termini Station, so you're close to Metro Lines A & B. My room was small, but since I was traveling on my own, that was no problem. There was no air-conditioning in my room. My only complaint about the hotel was that the customer service was pretty bad. I checked into the hotel with no greeting from the 2 people behind the desk at all! In fact, they conversed amongst themselves the whole time. When I checked out, someone (who appeared to be the hotel manager) was yelling at his entire staff of 5 in front of me and other customers. This was especially awkward. Overall impression: I wouldn't stay here again, despite the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: atexasfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first three nights on a 2 week trip around Italy. Overall, this was a good hotel. I booked it on Priceline for an INSANE rate so I really had low expectations. I was not disappointed and would likely stay here again. Here's why: It is directly across the street from the Termini. You can take a train from the airport to the Termini and walk across the street to the hotel. It's that simple. There's no worrying about getting a taxi to the hotel or walking around major tourist areas while wheeling luggage. (Note that the hotel is rather removed from the major attractions but they are all easily accessible via the subway.) There are also rental cars in the Termini and it is fairly easy to get out of town from this location if you're driving. Tour companies that operate buses down to Naples and Pompeii are a few blocks away. The hotel can book these reservations for you. There are a few good restaurants near the hotel - one next door (from what I remember) and several behind the hotel. It's true that the area is a little sketchy at night, but I'm a young female (and was traveling with another young female) and I never, at any time, felt unsafe. There's a 24-hr internet location next door. The rates are cheap and they sell calling cards to the US for about 5 euro. On to the hotel itself - yes, the rooms are small and the shower is even smaller. It is probably comparable to a boutique hotel in New York. However, it was super clean and modern. The air conditioning worked great and the room had high ceilings. I heard that breakfast was OK, but we never woke up early enough to try it. I think they ended fairly early. The staff are not the nicest but certainly no worse than any other place I've stayed. I would suggest paying in cash or pre-paying in advance through an online site. I heard of a few people who had problems paying with credit - either they would claim the machine didn't read their card or would flat-out refuse to take the card due to "machine problems." Bottom line - I would recommend it and will likely stay here on my next trip. As long as you go in with average expectations, you probably won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms in this hotel for the end of feb-2008 and went to roma with my brother. We had a great time. I tried to book the Scott's house but that hotel was fully booked so they redirected us to the Aphrodite Hotel. I can't imagine people had a bad time here. The rooms were clean and the breakfast is very good for an Italian breakfast. The location can't be better. It's 20 meter from the Termini entrance and therefor excellent if you arrive by Terravision bus from Ciampino. I would really like to stay here again. For people want to have contact with their families: next to the hotel is a very cheap internet-cafe.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGirl82
Reviews.Content: The staff was very rude. Everyone we met was not helpful. The rooms were not very clean and they did not change the sheets at all, they only made up a dirty bed. the exception was the bathroom which was clean, but cramped. the rooms were small. and the entire hotel is very noisy, so expect to be woken up when people go upstairs for breakfast. I am disappointed that Frommer's would recommend this place. However it is easy to access the train station. i would choose another hotel, if i ever went to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Boogybeth
Reviews.Content: Rude staff. Both normal TV and satellite TV services were advertised, yet you have to pay extra for this if you want it! Our room stunk of faeces and the curtains were broken. The pillows were paper thin and the shower was not large enough to fit a small child.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare trip”
Reviews.Author: foodieReadingpa
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel Aphrodite based on a recommendation and it was a bad decision. We got married in Cortona and had several people travel to Rome staying at this hotel including my husband's daughter. They canceled their room claiming that the credit card didn't go through, but our reservation was fine using the same credit card. Finally after much discussion with the front desk, a room was located for her. Our room had a leaky toilet and was extremely noisy because it was across the street from the train station. I recommended 4 couples to stay at the hotel and am extremely disappointed in the hotel compared to the rating it received. We had to put a deposit on the remote control for the TV! The only positive aspect is that it is close to the train station, but that is also negative because there are some very unsavory characters around the area and didn't feel safe especially at night. Unless you want to be near a train station, I wouldn't recommend it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Small”
Reviews.Author: eWineTraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the Aphrodite Hotel - the room was contemporary and beautiful and the staff was friendly. However, I can understand some complaints. The room, especially the shower, was VERY small. The average American who is used to spacious areas may find it claustrophobic. The mosaic shower was beautiful but the size of a coffin. It's convenient to the Termini station but not much around to do or eat. I would recommend this hotel, just be cautious of your comfort level in tight quarters.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare of an experience”
Reviews.Author: gunsy
Reviews.Content: Shocking. I have never experienced such rude and unhelpful service in any event in my life. The fridge was broken, the A/C was broken, the dryer in the bathroom was broken and the shower was so small i had to wash my armpits standing outside it. Putting on a warm smile and a soft friendly voice to report any damages was met with a scowl, a scoff and absolutely nothing done to rectify any problems. It's particularly unpleasant being met with looks of disdain everytime you're walking in and out particularly when you're making an effort to be cheerful, unobtrusive and pleasant. Breakfast consisted of faux-cheese slices wrapped in their plastic, sliced Spam meat and some clearly re-cycled dry croissants. The cheap-brand coco pops were edible and to give them credit the milk wasn't off. First-timers and over-nighters 'don't be fooled' like i was by the position on the map next to Termini Station. There are literally hundreds of taxis lined up outside the station and the fares are quite reasonalble. I did get luck a couple of times - a great place in Monterossa and an awesome villa near Sienna but i wish i had a look at this site before booking the Rome leg !

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Rome - hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lesjardins
Reviews.Content: Disappointing location. Seedy area with the smell of urine outside. Fine if you want to catch trains. Do not book trips out with hotel staff. Not honest. We paid by cash for a trip and on the day of the trip were told by the coach driver that we hadn't paid. Went back to our hotel and the hotel staff denied that we had paid for our trip. Very difficult to find a manager. No one wanted to know. Found a manager eventually but he didn't want to know. Would never go back to Rome. Can't believe the trickery and dishonesty in a Holy and Catholic city. Staff were impolite, bus driver to airport was very unhelpful. We had to load our suitcases ourselves. Breakfast was poor. Our holiday was ruined by the antics of the hotel staff. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorrainequain
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at this hotel, when we arrived there was no body at reception, the room was just ok. I paid to go on a trip along with my 2 sisters, i paid a girl at reception and was issued a reciept with her name on it, i handed her €153. When i went to go on the trip i was told my ticket had not been paid for. I spoke with numerous members of staff got NO SATISFACTION! My money was pocketed by staff and they didn't care. Also my room safe would not open when i had put my personal code in, when i asked for assistance one member of staff came up with a key and opened it straight away! i wasn't impressed with this as anyone could have robbed the safe. The staff were so ignorant and dismissive. I would never stay in this hotel again and would not advise anyone else too either. Outside the hotel you have homeless people and a strong smell of urine. we also saw 2 people injecting themselves with drugs outside the hotel. This was the worst stay/ holiday i've ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: Hipoint
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of Hotel Aphrodite, I wasn't expecting anything stellar but just a decent place to crash. In the end, I found my overall experience to be fairly underwelming. We arrived a bit early the day of check-in and therefore had to check our bags. Not a big problem except that you had to find a place among the 30 other bags that were already stuffed in the closet. Regardless, after re-organizing a few bags we were able to squeeze ours in. We then went and toured Rome by foot for a few hours. When we came back for check-in, we were handed our room card (the staff did seem indifferent to any questions/needs we had). Upon getting into our room (#207), we noticed that the decor wasn't quite as nice as the hallways or the pictures I had seen on their website. The room was fairly small but livable. The air conditioner was unfortunately "underpowered". It had been turned off prior to our arrival and does not have fan speed control. You set the temp to the lowest setting and hope it cools the room down. Although it did cool down to a "decent" level, it was not as comfortable as some of the other hotels we had stayed in Italy. Checking out our room further, we found our mini-bar fridge broken. Despite multiple calls to the front desk, it was never repaired during our 4 days and hence we never had anything we could keep cool. Our hairblower was also not functional as someone had pulled the hose out from it's socket. It too was never fixed during our stay. The bathroom itself was quite small. The shower stall could barely fit one person. I had to turn the shower off while in it just to shampoo or soap myself. My wife couldn't even shave her legs! Leaving the bathroom and going back to the bedroom, our "queen" bed was actually two twins put together with a headboard lamp hanging right over our pillows...we fortunately didn't electricute our heads despite banging into it a few times. The mattress was quite old as we could feel the metal springs digging into us. In the middle of the night, people can be heard in the hallways and I'm sure they could hear us. This was not a big problem overall. In the morning, there is a breakfast of mostly breads/cereal/ham/cheese and a few juices...nothing fancy. Lastly, there is no internet access at Hotel Aphrodite despite what is sometimes advertised. Despite the shortcomings of Hotel Aphrodite, it is located in a prime location next to the Train Station and bus stop giving it a few positives. On my next trip to Rome, however, I probably would consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: suspend6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally directly across the road from the main rail station in the heart of Rome (Rome Termini). Very convenient location if traveling by train. The hotel was very clean and modern, having been recently refurbished. But the room was the smallest room we have ever stayed in over our 22 years of traveling the world. (Room 112). It was self contained, but not much bigger than the (small) double bed and desk within it. As we only used it for an overnight stay before catching a cruise ship the next day, it served its purpose at an affordable price. A good continental breakfast was included. I would stay there again, but next time, I would pay a little more and get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Melster
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and stayed in this hotel at the beginning and the end of our 2 week stay. It definitely was a great location as it is very close to the Termini station and if you are planning on doing any travel by rail almost all of the destinations that you are going to will leave from this station. The first room we had had a really nice large bathroom with a jet tub (the jets didn't work) but it was still big compared to most European bathrooms!! The rooms were clean and because we were not facing the street it was quiet. They have a nice little terrace on the 5th floor that has a patio set and it is a nice place to sit and have a drink in the evening. I would also recommend the restaurant on the corner (I think it is called the Capitello) as it had excellent service , reasonable prices and good food compared to some of the other restaurants near the hotel. (It is just to the left on the corner as you exit the hotel) I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Liars!!! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: TennisProPlayer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travel agent. After 15 hours of flight, we arrived at this place. Booking was confirmed way ahead of time, we presented the Voucher ticket, but the receptionist told us that our travel agent made a mistake by overbooking. We complained and requested that they confirmed with our travel agent, but all the talks lead to nowhere. Their only standard response was "Zis iz naut our fault. You can complain to your travel agent." The receptionist claimed this is not their fault and pushed us to another hotel (Scot House, which turned out to be an affiliate of Hotel Aphrodite and is rated 2 stars only.) After we returned home, we made a complaint to our travel agent, who in turned made inquiry to this situation. To my surprise, the travel agent said that the Hotel Aphrodite replied that during the date of our arrival, the room that was reserved for us had a broken door lock and so therefore it was not available. This is a total lie! The two ladies that we spoke with and wasted two hours there never said anything about a broken door lock! What a lie! I believe they oversold the rooms and tried to cheat us by giving us a less-expensive, affiliated(both hotel's front desks had broshures of each other), 2-star hotel! Our travel agent made apologies and was kind enough to refund us the money for the stay. Shame on this hotel! Be ware and stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hansen5
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Very clean, so close to the termini right accross the street. Everything leaves from the termini, trains, subway, buses and taxi's. You cannot go wrong! This is not a fancy hotel nice and basic small rooms with the essentials. The rooms -The bed was comfy enough with extra pillows and blankets. Our safe worked fine, though we had some friends on the 1st floor with a safe they could not get open. The cleaning people seemed professional and trustworthy and did a great job making up the room each day. It was always immaculate. Showers are small...I am a large guy 6'4 and 300 pounds and had no trouble using the small shower or the toilet etc... The shower does drain slow if you have the pressure on full we figured this out the first day and ran a little lower water pressure in the shower...still more than enough to shower comfortably. The queen beds were sufficiently big too and the sheets wer not scratchy. We kept our Termini Station view window open every night and enjoyed sleeping to the city sounds from the street. We were on the second level. The remodel is still evident tile and floors, and furniture are nice. The tv is small and you do need to leave a ten euro deposit for the remote...not many channels available all in Italian...fun. The room felt plenty big enough for us to move around in and have our luggage out etc...We were not in Rome to stay in our room we saw everything and we were exhausted at night. We did use the room phone and a calling card to make calls back home and had no extra charges from the hotel. All in all no surprises everything was great. You cannot beat this location and price! Our wives were really pleased with the cleanliness too! Breakfast was decent with breads - rolls danishes etc..., drinks - coffee, milk, yogurt and juice. Fruits and spreads even some ham and cheese. Ceral too. Everything tasted great and the area was neat and clean with a gal that was running her backside off. Service overall was very good! The elevator was workin fine to all 5 floors. We stayed at the Hotel Aphrodite fromt the 17th-24th of March. We had read many of the reviews and decided that it would work for us. We are medium budget travellers always looking for a good deal. We mainly booked this hotel because of it's location near the Termini. This was our first time to Rome and we could see that being near the Termini would be an advantage and it was extremily helpful! We also read that it would be good to carry our luggage on rather than to check it - this saved us time, and we were literaly at the hotel in our room less than 45 minutes after we landed. The express train from the airport is great you step off it at the termini walk to the opposite side of the station out on to Marsala and look to the right to see the Aphrodite. Too Easy! Everything leaves from the Termini station...it is the central hub of Rome! We found it to be so convenient. We also found it to be much safer than expected. The area did not seem at all dangerous and after a few days we felt right at home. Seriously I felt less safe in Hawaii.
