We ate at many different pizza places all were great...Florians was a stand out. For a great guide to the vatican or ancient Rome try Rich Brunn at rome-day-tours.com He is worth the money. Also be sure and get a reservation to see the Borghese gallery!

Reviews.Title: “Can be noisy!”
Reviews.Author: sarah57Wales
Reviews.Content: We,ve just returned from a 5 night stay in Rome. We stayed in a double room at the back of the hotel, which was a little smaller than our friends room at the front, however we didn,t suffer from the road noise at night. Our friends had to be asked to move on the last night due to 4 nights of very little sleep! Our room was really very nice, clean bright and with a nice modern decor. Read the previous review stating that the shower was a little on the small side, they must vary from room to room because ours was huge! One thing i would say for the ladies though is don't rely on the hairdryer in the room, it is not very powerful and takes forever to dry your hair! Breakfast was ok, the usual cheese, ham, cereals pastries. Was a bit dissapointed there was no bar as we usually travel with a group of friends and it's nice to start or end the night in the hotel. Having said that there are a few cafe/bars just up the road from the hotel which stay open really late and are very nice for a coffee and pastry in the morning. Hotel is a fantastic location, right opposite the termini. If you have the weather it's nice to walk around and see the sights. We took the map from reception which is very easy to follow. Some of our group thought it's a little too far to walk but the thing is if you get tired there are so many little cafes you can stop off at to top up the energy levels! We had lunch in the Piazza at the Pantheon one day, weather was stunning so we sat and people watched while enjoying good italian food and 2 bottles of wine. watch out for the hide and seek game played by the street vendors and the police (very amusing!) If you don't get the weather or don't fancy the walk, the metro is very easy and cheap to use. Doesn't take you right to the sights but will cut the walking to a minimum. Both routes blue and red our shown on the map from reception. We also did the 110 red tourist bus. It stops near all the main attractions and you can hop off and get back on as many times as you like. Overall had a fantastic trip and will definately use this hotel again. If you are a light sleeper though ask for a room at the back of the hotel or take some ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DoloresLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a midweek break in Rome. When looking through the different websites for suitable accommodation I was disappointed to see that a lot of the affordable hotels in Rome seem to be quite shabby and old looking. Fortunately, we came across this small hotel next to the Termini Railway Station which claimed to have been recently renovated and judging from the pictures looked appealing. Despite some of the previous reviews stating that the rooms could hardly fit a bed, we decided to give it a try and were pleasantly surprised at the condition and decor of the hotel in general. The room was a comfortable size for two people, and very bright, although the window had to be kept closed if you didn't want to hear the noise of the busy street. The location is very practical as you can either walk to many of the sites, like the Colosseum, Fountain of Trevi, Spanish Steps etc (all about 15 min walk) or alternatively use the underground from the station or buses to all areas just in front of the station. The airport transfer bus run by Ryanair (Terravision) also stops right by the hotel (under 100 yards away). However, as many other areas next to stations, the streets nearby may seem a bit on the seedy side but otherwise safe as in Rome in general. Breakfast is served in a glazed sunroom at the top of the building and consists of tea/coffee, cereals, yoghurt, bread and spreads and a variety of pastries, which was adequate. The breakfast is served between 7.30am and 10am. If I have to find something with room for improvement, it would probably be the size of the shower cubicles. Although just adequate for us, a large person would probably find it uncomfortable, as it was just about 2ft x 2ft (a bit on the tight side!). We would definitely recommend this hotel and will go back anytime we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: bjeffreym
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern hotel. Staff very friendly. Katia at the front desk was a standout. Stayed Nov.9 -18. Had KING bed tiny room for 2 people. Cool glass tile in small bathroom. No shampoo provided. No shelves in bathroom or in tiny shower. No in-room iron. Room too warm upon check-in, had to leave window open entire stay. Across from Termini very convenient, but noisey with window open. There is A/C control in room, however, if main unit for entire hotel is on "heat", that is all you get, as was explained to me. Peeked in other rooms as they were being cleaned, so there are a bit larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Only, Definitely Not Three Star”
Reviews.Author: cgribb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the smallest I have ever seen, queen size bed took up entire room. Bathroom barely big enough to allow one person in, shower would not drain away the water, took two hours to drain. No internet as advertised, only one TV Sky Channel. Was supposed to stay 7 days booked out after 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: rachelk55
Reviews.Content: Being in Europe for the first time, I wasn't sure what to expect hotel-wise. I had heard the rooms were tiny, the bathrooms were tiny and the continental breakfasts were terrible. I was pleasantly surprised staying here! We stayed in a triple room, and were a bit confused when a pullout couch was the third bed... but otherwise the rooms were spacious, at least compared to some of the other hotels we ended up staying in. The bathroom was nice too. The shower was a little cramped, and there was no shelf to put our shampoo on, but that didn't really make much difference. We saw some of the other rooms that other members of our tour group were staying in, and all of them were clean and new looking. The breakfasts were basic, not the best we had, but the croissants were good, especially the whole wheat ones (when they brought them out). As a bonus, this hotel was in a great location (Right across the street from Termini) so it was very easy to get around the city. The area itself is a little seedy, but what do you expect for being so close to the central train station? Also, this hotel had an elevator, which I later learned was not all that common in a budget hotel. We got spoiled for 6 days!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed the second time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Aphrodite July 5-9 with a group of six women. We had two triple rooms. These were just OK. Although the Aphrodite had been remodeled recently, it appears that some upkeep is now necessary. Bathroom fixtures are in great need of repair/ replacement and the comforters on the beds and sofas need a good scrub. The air conditioning was almost Non-existant resulting in us having to open the window, letting in mosquitoes. Otherwise it is still very clean. The noise level can be an issue if you are a light sleeper. The staff is courteous and its location to Termini cannot be beat for the price. My husband and I stayed here in 2004 and it is on a downward turn as far as upkeep. I am having issues with charges pending on my debit card for one night for each room which should not be applied since I paid in cash upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems”
Reviews.Author: Noles9498
Reviews.Content: Having prior expierenc with the proprietors of this hotel, I was looking forward to our stay. Initially I was not disappointed, as it was conveniently located near Termini, non-smoking, all of the fixtures and furniture were new, and the desk staff spoke good English and were helpful and efficient. However, an hour after our travel companions return to their room to change out of their WEDDING ATTIRE, our friends received a call from the front desk asking them to run the shower for five minutes so they could test a leak in the room below. The bride asked if they could wait, seeing that the couple was one hour post-wedding. Evidently it could not wait and our friends complied, and were shortly thereafter were shuffled off to an even smaller room. (Originally we weren't bothered with the shoebox sized rooms seeing that we have come to expect that in big cities.) The second room suffered from dripping condensation from the air vent and our friends listened to the drip, drip, drip, all night rather than be shuffled to a third room. The staff did, however, allow them a late checkout to compensation. Of course, they didn't adequately note that anywhere so we had to struggle with each change of shift to make them aware. So . . . while the initial appearance was good, I'd have to say the substance was a bit lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Istayed at the Aphrodite for one night and found that it more than met my expectations for a budget hotel in Rome's center. The location is ideal (its just across the street) if you need to catch a train from the large Rome Termini train station. The room was very small, but looked like it had been recently rennovated with nice decorative touches. The bathroom/shower were new and were quite spacious given the size of the room. My room was on the street side of the hotel, Via Marsalla, but once I closed the large double pane window, I was able to completly shut out the noise from the street below. Air conditioning worked fine and the entry door is secured with an electronic card key. Breakfast was what you might expect in a buget hotel with cold cereal, rolls, juice, coffee and even a capucino bar. Front desk staff seemed freindly and efficient and spoke English good enough to help the non-Italian speaker. For the traveller needing to make connections to the airports or other destinations in Italy, this hotel offers value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel across the 2006 New Year Holiday. To be honest, we were expecting a lesser deal after reading about some less than appreciative reviews on the hotel. Space is usually what you would expect in European cities but being newly renovated, we can't find a fault with the hotel nor the room, especially the bathroom (with what appears to be venetian murano glass on the walls). Breakfast spread is also well within expectations. It was a most comforting stay on our European tour.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean”
Reviews.Author: windyhabour
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night in December,The rooms are small but clean & modern.There is a modern lift.Building is modern too.Must pay deposit for TV remote control????No English Channels,Breakfast terrible and Reception staff inexperienced!Credit card machine did not work on checkout resulting in me having to find cash and missing my train.(no discount!)Location is good near railway for those with train to catch.would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: oldmanteddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at thr Hotel Aphrodite for two nights in October. The hotel itself is quite nice well maintained with a pleasant staff. The morning buffet is as so many have written just adequate. The only negative is the location. We were disappointed that there was so little shopping in the area except for the shops in the train station

Reviews.Title: “Just stay someplace else...”
Reviews.Author: DrFly
Reviews.Content: I booked a full week in this hotel, but stayed only one night. The building is old, there's no lift (if you want to climb 4 floors with your baggage...) and the rooms are even worse than the dorm I slept in during my time in the army. Just don't go there...

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAUKUJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aphrodite, near Termini station during our trip to Italy and i would not recommend this hotel for three reasons. Firstly- the location is quite undesirable as it is right next to Termini station and there are a large number of unsociable characters that hang around the station form dusk onwards. Secondly- the airconditioning in the hotel sucks and is NOT individually controlled though there is a temperature dial in every room just for effect. Thirdly- the breakfast was awful with very cold coffee/tea and poor selection of breads. However if you have already booked your room then pay in cash whilst checking out and save yourself 10 Euro's per night.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silk_purse99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in July in a double room. Room was fine - air conditioning worked, it was VERY clean - house keeping is possibly best feature of this hotel. Also receptionist very pleasant. The breakfast was TOTAL CRAP. All prepacked rubbish - poor quality wrapped cheese squares, dog food spam, hard rolls, anaemic cereal and an arrogant breakfast room attendant who looked with disdain on anyone who might eat the crap that he presided over. In fact, I know that my cats would not have eaten there!! If you dont eat breakfast this could be a very good hotel to stay in. Reasonably priced and in a good area to explore Rome, the termini, buses and metro, trains across the road. We did not have trouble with beggars and pickpockets in this area. Good and reasonably priced places to eat and drink nearby! Would not stay there again. Would go for bigger hotels with more facilities e.g. better breakfast and a bar etc

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Convenient, Unlovely Street”
Reviews.Author: sumersfree
Reviews.Content: It worked for us, but I wouldn't recommend it to friends. Our triple room at Hotel Aphrodite was so small we couldn't have more than one suitcase at a time open on the floor. Beds were narrower than standard twins. Bathroom so tight, a large person would have trouble on the toilet. However-- clean and convenient to train station (across the street). We took the subway around Rome, so this was a good spot for us. Breakfast was not interesting -- plastic wrapped slices of cheese, lunchmeat ham (not prosciutto), a single fellow working there, restocking supplies and clearing tables and clearly put out if asked to make a cup of cappuccino. However -- rooms were spotless, air conditioning worked, staff was friendly (except for breakfast room guy). The street is a little rough. Drunks sleeping it off under benches in the morning. Lots of good cheap places to eat, however, and one restaurant that was fabulous, just two doors down (Antica Osteria Giustiniani da Paolo). Going again, I would research hotels that were another block or two east of here -- and there are dozens.

Reviews.Title: “What a fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my boyfriend and it was wonderful - we were the first of the day to check in so we could choose which room we wanted. We picked the room on the top floor, with a huge bathroom and whirlpool bath. Staff were very friendly and location very convenient. Breakfast could have been a bit better, and it was a shame the roof terrace was being renovated, but I would absolutely not hesitate in staying here again, or recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: topsy2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at "Aphrodite" last week. Most reports we read before we went were very accurate. Fairly small room, VERY small shower, but powerful! Breakfast....basic but adequate! Staff...polite and helpful but not over friendly (to be fair, maybe the language barrier, our Italian was no better than their English!!!) Cannot fault the cleanliness of this hotel in any way, everything was spotless!! Surrounding area...........great for trains, buses and Metro, just minutes away. There are quite a lot of homeless/beggars around, but we never felt threatened at all by them. A bit of noise from the street at night.........ok at this time of year when you can keep the window closed. At 90 euros per night, quite a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly BUT.......!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aphrodite for 3 nights last week. The hotel is absolutely spotless and the staff are helpful and polite. The location is extremely near the termini so it is extremely noisy. Unfortunately the air con in our room wouldn't work so we had to have the window open all night - needless to say we didn't get much sleep because of the noise! We were looking forward to sitting on the rooftop terrace looking out over Rome but it was being renovated and even if we could have sat there all we would have been able to see was the roof of the Termini!!! There isn't a lounge or bar to sit in- there are no coffee/ tea making facilities in the rooms. The tiny claustraphobic breakfast area closes after breakfast and it is not possible to get a hot drink after that. We had to go to a local cafe to get one and bring it back to our room. If I was going back to Rome I would opt to stay in a different area- possibly near the Trevi fountain / spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Sewage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was appalled by the treatment we received at this hotel. Our room smelt dreadfully of sewage and bad drains to the point that it was unbearable to be in the room. We made numerous very reasonable requests for a solution to the receptionist who told us she was on her own, couldn't get us another room and no manager would be there until the morning. She was unable to offer any sort of solution so after much debate, we moved to another hotel. We returned to the hotel in the morning to complain to the manager and to ensure that we would not be charged for the night. The manager accused us of lying and argued with us for a full one hour before agreeing not to charge us for such appalling service! She accused me of being a "terrible person"! Worst customer service skills I have ever encountered, clearly the manager is only interested in lining her pocket, regardless of the quality she offers to her clients. Her closing line as she agreed not to charge us was "well, fine, you are unacceptable but you won't make me poor!"

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aphrodite form 20 to 25th Feb 2005 it is in a good location for getting around, my wife and I stayed in a double room which was very small even though it had a extra single bed in an annexe. The bathroom was clean and modern shower was excellent. The cleaning was very good. We had a small problem that the plug was missing from the sink despite asking countless times they seemed unable or unwilling to replace it, which was very unprofessional. The staff at the desk are polite but very dismissive do not think they are very keen on English people. The brekfast was very poor very little choice worst ever for an inclusive breakfast no meat of any sort cramped room to eat in inedible yoghurt, cornflakes, as for the musli i had to look at the bag to be sure it did not say Rabbit food Please do not follow the recommendation of where to eat we eat next door which they said was excellent, the food was inedible the service non existent they invent things to put on the bill. much better a few doors on an excellent restaraunt serving teriffic food cheaply, pizzas are best ever tasted. Beware the area around the station is full of low life beggars everyone hassling you for money and very unsafe in my opinion. The friends that we went with had her bag and purse snatched losing several hundreds of pounds in euros and sterling which made us very nervous walking around and only did so as a group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One thing you can't overlook, is the location of this Hotel, across the street from the Roma Termini train station is absolutely fantastic, esspecially if you are travelling by train through Italy. The Leonardo express from the airport stops there. But the room is small, it's just enough space to breathe. We got a rate of 90Euro per double room 3rd to 5th December, which is reasonable. The a/c cannot be adjusted, the only way to get air in, is to open the window, we got a room facing the next building not the street, so at least it wasn't noisy when we had the window open. The bathroom is beautiful, but the shower cubicle is damn small, I had trouble just turning around in it, and I'm an average size guy. The bed is comfortable though. Breakfast is adequate, continental type. There is a free internet station available from 12PM, eventhough the sign says 12AM. Staff are reasonably helpful but not overly friendly. Overall, a great place to base yourself if you intend to be out most of the day sigtseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: risingstar
Reviews.Content: I, along with 2 friends, stayed in a triple room at the Hotel Aphrodite in Rome in November 2004. I recommend the hotel because it is a good value (110 euros for a triple room) and in an excellent location. It is directly across the street from Termini, allowing easy access to all public transportation. The staff is very friendly. There are not a lot of amenities at this hotel, although they do serve a decent breakfast. The hotel was remodeled in 2003 and is in excellent shape and very clean. My only criticisms are the rooms, even a triple, are very small. There is very little room to move around. If you are sharing a room, be sure it is someone you don't mind being in very close quarters with. Also, the shower is small beyond belief. It is smaller than a telephone booth and there is no room to even move your arms. They should remove the bidets and make the shower big enough so that you can use your arms to bath without banging on the glass. Lastly, there is no individual climate control in each room. There is a thermostat, but it does not appear to controlable by the rooms' occupants. We kept our window open, eventhough it was 50 degrees outside, just to keep the room bearably cool. The drawback to that was that we had to listen to all of the street activity, which is considerable, going on at Termini all night long. All in all, this is a great property for the price. It is very clean and the staff is pleasant. If you will not be spending a lot of time in your room, it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: Ramblin_on_4ever
Reviews.Content: This is well placed hotel, a few meters from the main Termini station (good transport links to attractions). The area is composed of around 80% tourists (hotels, bars, food places etc), and not as rough as guide books state. The hotel has been recently renovated - all nice and new inside. Room was clean, with a very nice bathroom. Staff were efficient and friendly. The main problem is the rediculously tiny breakfast room, rubbish breakfast with lukewarm coffee. Ironicaly on the roof is a nice veranda which would make a very good breakfast area. Other than that I'd say this was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Aphrodite (a small boutique hotel) near the train station as we were departing on a cruise the following evening. The hotel had just been remodeled and was wonderful. It had a really a nice deck on the roof. Although the room was small it was very clean, nicely appointed and quite adequate for a few nights. The hotel staff was excellent and they provided a continental breakfast in a small breakfast room. The location was perfect for our needs as we took the train to Rome from the airport and then the following afternoon we took the train to the port. This saved us approximatgely $175 in transfer charges, had we booked transfers through the cruise ship. The train station is also the starting point for the double deck bus tours and within walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Aphrodite was very rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, don't try to bring a guest to your room after 3 am. We were harrassed and threatened with police action by an incredibly rude desk person named Omar. After being told that guests were allowed, the rule was suddenly changed because Omar didn't like us. Think twice before staying at this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Aphrodite Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala 90, 00185 Rome, Italy
